bibl.title: Francis Stephen Medcraf vs. Robert T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE PETITION OF FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. ) No. 3038 Petition.
TO THE HONORABLE JEREMIAH NETERER, JUDGE OF SAID COURT;
The petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf respectfully shows;
That he is forty-(40) years of age and has declared his intention to become a citizen of the United States.

That your petitioner is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by ROBERT T. HODGE,who is the Sheriff of and for -----------------, King County, Washington at Seattle in said state in this district.
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to-wit:

That on the 18th day of May A. D. 1915, one H. F. Conover did make and file in writing, under oath, a compaint before Justice Reah M. Whitehead who was then and still is a Justice of the Peace in the State of Washington in and for Seattle Precinct in the County of King, which said complaint charged this petitioner with having on the third day of May 1915 committed the crime of "practicing dentistry without a certificate as follows:

He, said John Doe Medcraf" (meaning this petitioner) "in the county of King, state of Washington, on the 3rd day of May, 1915, did then and there wilfully and unlawfully practice dentistry and did then and there perform operations and parts of operations, and did then and there treat diseases and lesions of the human teeth and jaws of said H.F. Conover, said H. F. Conover then and there being a human being, and did then and there receive from said H. F. Conover, in payment therefor, the sum of two dollars ($2), without -1-
having first filed for record and having recorded in the office of the Auditor of the county wherein he then and there practiced, to wit, in the office of the Auditor of King County, State of Washington, a certificate from the Board of Dental Examiners of the State of Washington, authorizing him to so practice as provided by law, contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the State of Washington.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 18th day of May 1915
div1.ab: (Signed) Reah M. Whitehead Justice of the Peace, Seattle Precinct, King County, Washington."
div1.p: That thereupon the 21st day of May the said Reah M. Whitehead as such Justice of the Peace, issued a warrant in the name of the State of Washington in words and figures as follows:-
"WARRANT OF ARREST"
STATE OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING ) SS IN JUSTICE COURT, SEATTLE PRECINCT
To the Sheriff or Any Constable of said County:

Whereas H. F. Conover has this day complained in writing, under oath, to the undersigned one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, that on the 3rd day of May 1915 in said County and State, John Doe Medcraf did commit the crime of Practicing dentistry without a certificate.
Therefore, in the name of the State of Washington, you are commanded forthwith to apprehend the said John Doe Medcraf and bring him before me to be dealt with according to law.
Given under my hand this 21st day of May 1915.
div1.ab: (Signed) Reah M. Whitehead Justice of the Peace."
div1.p: And thereupon on that day your petitioner was arested by authority of said warrant, by Edward Shrewsbury, a constable, and taken before said Justice of the Peace who thereupon required him to give bail for his appearance to answer to said charge on the 3rd day of June 1915 at 1-30 o'clock P? M. and to stand committed to the county jail i default of such bail. That petitioner gave such bail and on said date his trial wascontinued until June 9th 1915 at 1-30 o'clock P. M. at which time he duly appeared before said Justice and moved to quash said writ and discharge petitioner upon the grounds and all thereof hereinafter stated;- towit, the unconstitutionality of the statutes of the State of Washington hereinafter set forth as hereinafter specified. Said motions being denied, the Court holding said laws to be valid and constitutional, received evidence and all the facts hereinafter recited were fully shown. Thereupon the said court found petitioner guilty as charged and adjudged him to pay a fine of $ and to stand committed until such fine be paid, to the County Jail of King County, not exceeding 20 days, and thereupon issued the warrant of commitment in pursuance of said judgment and your petitioner is now in custod thereunder and is so detained by the Sheriff of King County Washington (Annotated) whish are as follows;
"8416. (3025*) Examinations-Certificate.

Any person or persons seeking to practice dentistry in the state of Washington, or to (own) , operate or cause to be operated, (or to run or manage) a dental office or place for the practice of dentistry in the state of Washington after the passage of this act shall file his or her name, together with an application for examination, with the secretary of the state board of dental examiners, and at the time of making such application shall pay to the secretary\ of the board a fee of twenty-five dollars. and to present him or herself at the first regular meeting thereafter of said board to undergo examination before that body. No person shall be eligible for such an examination unless he or she shall be of good moral character and shall present to said board his or her diploma from some dental college in good standing and shall give satisfactory evidence of his or her rightfu possession of the same: Provided, this section shall not apply to persons engaged in the practice of dentistry at the time of the passage of this act who are bona fide citizens of the state of Washington. All persons successfully passing such examination shall beregistered as licensed dentists in the board register as hereinafter provided, and also receive a certificate, said certificate to be signed by the president and secretary of said board and in

This is to certify that is hereby licensed to practice dentistry in the state of Washington. This certificate must be filled for record in the offie of the auditor of any county in which the party holding such certificate desires to practice, and it is unlawful for him (or her) to practice dentistry in any county in which said certificate is not filed for record.
Dated at this day of , A. D. 190 .
div1.ab: ((President of said board of examiners.) (Secretary of said board.)
div1.p: "8417. (3026) Certificate to be Recorded.

The certificates in this chapter provided for shall entitle the holder thereof to practice dentistry in any county in the state of Washington: Provided, such certificate shall first be filed for record in the office of the auditor of the county in which such holder desires to practice, and nothing herein contained shall be construed to permit any holder of any certificate to practice in any county in this state unless such certificate shall have been first recorded in the office of the auditor of such county as herein provided: Provided further, that any such holder of a certificate may practice in more than one or any number of counties in this state on having such certificate recorded in each of such counties in which such holder desires to so practice. Said board of dental examiners shall, upon satisfac
